channel.title: Projects on Andy's Garden
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Andy's Garden

item.title: Terminal Logging With Color
item.description: These days I’ve been writing a lot of babashka instead of reaching for bash or python to do minor scripting tasks at work. I am also a big fan of the work done at charm and the relevant products in this case are gum and lipgloss. Using gum style I can log any text in basically any color I want. And while there’s not a ton of functional benefits to this, I think there’s something to be said about adding color into the logs we write.

item.title: Clojurescript Project Setup
item.description: Outcomes By the end of this post, you will be able to setup a new clojurescript project, setup emacs to be your development environment, and deploy your app to Github Pages Background I’ve written two clojurescript projects now, Sundial and DataBooze, and I want to document the set up process. The first time was a massive undertaking because it was my first time. But frustrating enough, so was the second time, even though I thought I nailed down the process and took notes on it.
